alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 21 at 8:33PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Marshall, Jackson, central DeKalb and eastern Franklin Counties through 900 PM CDT... At 833 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles east of Manchester to 6 miles northwest of Geraldine. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Scottsboro, Fort Payne, Rainsville, Bridgeport, Henagar, Stevenson, Sylvania, Cowan, Fyffe and Hollywood. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
